resources.string: Labs are friendly, outgoing, and high-spirited companions
German Pointers are very intelligent, responsive, and eager to please
The Cavalier is a sweet, gentle, and affectionate breed
Border Collies are highly intelligent and highly trainable
These are smart, social, mischievous dogs who demand love and attention
Beagles are active, energetic dogs who need at least an hour of exercise every day
The dignified Dalmatian, dogdom\'s citizen of the world, is famed for his spotted coat and unique job description.
Lowchen is a European breed known for its petite frame, mane-like fur, and playful attitudes
French Bulldogs are quirky, playful and full of energy
Akitas are quiet, fastidious dogs. Wary of strangers and often intolerant of other animals
Bichons have a reputation for being difficult to housebreak. In every other respect, however, they are very easy to train.
Golden retrievers are playful, yet gentle with children, and they tend to get along well with other pets and strangers.
The pharaoh hound is calm, quiet and clean, content to stretch out on your best sofa and sleep as long as you have given him a daily run or romp.

Pit bulls were bred to be courageous and game, to continue whatever they are doing in the face of adversity. These qualities make them stubborn, tenacious and fearless. As with any large dog, pit bulls should be supervised when with children.
Rottweilers can be service dogs, therapy dogs, obedience competitors, guide dogs, customs inspectors, drafting and carting dogs, and of course, devoted companions.
Despite their size, Dachshunds are known for their courageous nature and will take on animals much larger than themselves
English Setters are elegant but solid dogs of beauty and charm.
Great Danes are sociable, friendly, and eager to please, and they respond well to firm, consistent training methods.
Irish wolfhounds have a heart as big as the rest of them. They are gentle, noble, sensitive and easygoing. Despite the fact that they can run at great speed.
The Pug has been bred to be a companion and a pleasure to his owners. He has an even and stable temperament, great charm, and an outgoing, loving disposition.
The Papillon is happy, alert, and friendly. He should never be shy or aggressive.
Miniature poodles are smart, active, and playful. They love to romp and play nearly non-stop as puppies and young dogs
English bulldogs have a sweet disposition, are predictable, dependable and excellent with children and need only moderate exercise.
Tenacious, feisty, brave, and sometimes bossy, the Yorkie exhibits all the traits of a true terrier.
Boxers are stocky, muscular and powerful. Their jaw is undershot and the muzzle blunt.

Siberian huskies are probably best-known for their incredible sled-pulling skills, but these doggies are not all business! Indeed, they make excellent working dogs, as they were bred originally to help the Chukchi people of Siberia hunt more efficiently. But they\'re sweet, friendly, and loyal cuddle bugs, too
The breed is famously easygoing, mild, and good-natured, especially those raised in a home.

A Doberman Pinscher is extremely loyal to his family. A Doberman Pinscher is very sweet and affectionate with the family children, provided he has been raised with them. He views the kids as the puppies in the pack. A Doberman Pinscher is a fantastic guard dog that will be the ultimate protector for your kids.
Harriers are loving and amiable but also tend to have an independent nature, and they can be stubborn.
